event: On this day in 1892, Ellis Island opened in New York Harbor as an immigration station. Millions of hopeful travelers would pass through its halls.
On this day in 1839, Louis Daguerre took the first photo of the Moon. It marked an early milestone in photography.
On this day in 1959, Alaska became the 49th state of the United States. It is the largest state by area.
On this day in 1809, Louis Braille, the inventor of the Braille reading system, was born in France.
On this day in 1933, construction of the Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco began. It later became one of the most famous bridges in the world.
On this day in 1850, the safety razor was first patented in the United States, changing daily grooming habits.
On this day in 1935, Elvis Presley, who would become the King of Rock and Roll, was born in Mississippi.
On this day in 2007, Apple introduced the first iPhone, revolutionizing mobile technology.
On this day in 1863, the world's first underground railway opened in London, now part of the famous Tube system.
On this day in 1935, Amelia Earhart became the first person to fly solo from Hawaii to California.
On this day in 1969, Led Zeppelin released their debut album, helping to define rock music of the era.
On this day in 1968, Johnny Cash recorded his legendary live album at Folsom Prison.
On this day in 1973, the Miami Dolphins completed the only perfect season in NFL history by winning the Super Bowl.
On this day in 1706, Benjamin Franklin, inventor and statesman, was born in Boston.
On this day in 1919, Bentley Motors was founded in London, becoming known for luxury cars.
On this day in 1809, Edgar Allan Poe, the American poet and writer, was born in Boston.
On this day in 1885, the roller coaster was patented, later becoming a favorite amusement park ride.
On this day in 1849, Elizabeth Blackwell became the first woman to earn a medical degree in the United States.
On this day in 1935, the first canned beer was sold in the United States.
On this day in 1924, the first Winter Olympics opened in Chamonix, France.
On this day in 1905, the world's largest diamond, the Cullinan, was discovered in South Africa.
On this day in 1880, Thomas Edison patented the electric light bulb, transforming everyday life.
On this day in 1886, Karl Benz patented the first automobile powered by a gas engine.
On this day in 1969, The Beatles performed together for the last time in their rooftop concert in London.
On this day in 1958, the United States launched Explorer 1, its first satellite, into space.
